title: NewsBreak: Oil Prices Fall on Report of Saudi Quickly Restoring Output
text:
NewsBreak: Oil Prices Fall on Report of Saudi Quickly Restoring Output

Commodities 9 hours ago (Sep 17, 2019 15:55)

© Reuters. Investing.com -- Oil prices tumbled Tuesday after a Reuters report cited a Saudi official as predicting the kingdom could fully restore oil output within two to three weeks. Earlier reports had suggested that it would take far longer to bring output back to normal after missile attacks at the weekend took an estimated 5.77 million barrels a day of production offline. at $59.62 a barrel vs $62.02 immediately before the report.

futures at $65.64 a barrel vs $67.77 before hand.

Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman is due to hold a press conference at 1.15 PM ET (1715 GMT)

NewsBreak: Oil Prices Fall on Report of Saudi Quickly Restoring Output
description: NewsBreak: Oil Prices Fall on Report of Saudi Quickly Restoring Output
